Name: Clashing Blades
QuestDesc: You have discovered the three tokens' purpose and directions, but the answers to their riddles are hidden behind a mysterious entrance, which you found with help from the Sundial's hints.

Chapters.Title: Go back to Jinzhou and meet with Chixia

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How did it go? Anyone hurt? Lemme check on you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phew! You're still in one piece.

Options.PlotLineKey: Course I am. You're overreacting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay okay. Anything new about the tokens?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You tell Chixia of your findings in the Desorock Highlands and Qichi Village.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So those Fractsidus goons are here in Jinzhou now. Things are more serious than I thought.

Options.PlotLineKey: I wonder what they are up to.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Beats me. I've only ran into some bozos before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those wackos are hellbent on making their own Resonators. Said there's no right or wrong when it comes to Resonance powers and everyone should have the right to them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They use mechanical manipulation to integrate parts of Tacet Discords into human bodies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seeking power with such gruesome acts... I cannot bring myself to understand them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That Scar guy you mentioned sounds like he's on a whole other level. How did the fight go?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He... It seems he didn't intend to kill us. I would say he was even pulling his punches.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know what he wants from us. But Madam Magistrate may have intended to hint something by letting us run into him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I still can't wrap my head around what happened in that village...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I went over the files. That case is ancient. It was dealt with and archived way before our current Magistrate took office.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What happened to the village in the end?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, the crooks were brought to justice, and most of the villagers were relocated to new settlements.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I didn't find anything in the files about that little girl you mentioned.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So Scar really did take her away.

Options.PlotLineKey: And it seems he did not hurt her.
Maybe the Fractsidus had plans to use her for something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I agree.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If only we could capture him...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh... I'm so lost. Why did Madam Magistrate point you to Qichi Village anyway? What did she want to tell you with that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And then Scar went there to tamper with the site and mislead you with fake clues...

Options.PlotLineKey: Or maybe it's the other way around.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus was planning to tell you something about what had happened in that village. Then our Magistrate intercepted by leading you there before they could?

Options.PlotLineKey: Scar wanted to preach his ideas to me.
I suppose she just made use of the occasion.
She knew what was going to happen.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Madam Magistrate knew they were going to lure you to the village. And she knew they weren't planning to kill you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her token was a warning that the Fractsidus had their eyes on you...

Options.PlotLineKey: Plus, even if Scar really tried to kill us...
We wouldn't be in real danger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How so?

Options.PlotLineKey: Jinzhou's way of hospitality, remember?
In a game of Weiqi, when the Black moves, White is sure to follow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean she's got someone looking out for you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or maybe she prepared other means of protection.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, I agree. Knowing their plans, Madam Magistrate would have prepared countermeasures for the worst scenario.

Options.PlotLineKey: And vice versa. Since the White has made her move...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's the matter, Rover?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh, I don't think I follow.

Options.PlotLineKey: Nothing in particular.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The legendary figure who changed Jinzhou's history, a looming war with the resurrecting Threnodian, and the Fractsidus acting in the shadows...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If all of these have something to do with your true identity. Then... who exactly are you?

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm hoping Madam Magistrate has the answer.
I am your friend, the one you know as Rover.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes... You will always be the Rover we know, no matter what.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That same old TD eating, Echo munching Rover all right!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come to think of it, the sundial's the last token we need to work out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Mortefi said it's an intricate puzzle box. Madam Magistrate might have hid her real message inside.

Options.PlotLineKey: We learned about the time at the Academy.
We learned about the direction in Qichi Village.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. It's the 12th Shichen of the day, represented by the symbol Wei.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. It's the South, represented by the Vermillion Bird, one of the Four Symbols.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now we have the Shichen of Wei and Vermillion Bird. We should be able to solve the puzzle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back in Jinzhou, you reunite with Chixia and share your findings from Desorock Highland and Qichi Village. You suspect Jinhsi intentionally led you there after learning of the Fractsidus' plan, but her true intentions remain unclear until you solve the sundial puzzle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, Rover, you're gonna try it now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Symbols on the larger disk represent time, and we need to align the correct symbol with this pointer. It should be...

Options.PlotLineKey: The Shichen of Yoh.
The Shichen of Wei.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not working. So we can rule out the <ano=Time Period>Shichen</ano> of Yoh now... The correct time we learned at the Academy should be...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's working. And now...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Symbols on the smaller disk represent direction, and we need to align the correct symbol with this pointer. It should be...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We have Teal Loong of the East, White Tiger of the West, Vermilion Bird of the South, and Black Tortoise of the North. According to the clues we've gathered, it should be...

Options.PlotLineKey: White Tiger of the West.
Vermilion Bird of the South.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not working. I guess it's not the White Tiger...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wow, you really solved it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (So this is the last message the Magistrate has for me. This is... the location of Jinzhou's Grand Library.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, I don't think it's something we're allowed to see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Quick, Yangyang. We should turn around!

Options.PlotLineKey: Why should you?
It's nothing you can't see.
We solved this together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's gotta be some super confidential stuff Madam Magistrate's written for Rover's eyes only!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As public servants... Well, even though we're both just reservists. We know there are rules to follow!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chixia has a point.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe you should read it first, Rover?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come on, just go ahead and see what's written inside!

Options.PlotLineKey: It's about the Grand Library...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. The Grand Libraries in Huanglong are renowned for their vast databases, holding valuable information about the regions they represent. Their exact locations are kept confidential, but it is believed they hold answers to all questions one could ask.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Grand Libraries are vital for Huanglong's data security, managed by the regional Sentinels, accessible only to the Magistrates. They are rarely open to the public.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Kinda like a big piggy bank inside the City Hall. Data-wise!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. You will find the most comprehensive and accurate information there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, if you'll need to visit the Grand Library in Jinzhou to find out who you are, I think it suggests two things...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: First, there is a strong link between your past and Jinzhou's history.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Second, you must be a really significant person.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you're super important to Jinzhou, maybe even all of Huanglong...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wow, I think we stumbled upon a real big shot when we didn't even know it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's that matter, Rover? Something wrong with the sundial?

Options.PlotLineKey: Is the City Hall at the center of Jinzhou?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is Jinzhou's political center. And it's also located at the city's center, if that's what you mean.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The City Hall was built first when Jinzhou was established. It's a popular landmark for locals giving directions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why do you ask, Rover?

Options.PlotLineKey: Nothing in particular.
Madam Magistrate wishes to meet me alone.
I'll need to go somewhere on my own.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: See? What did I say! Covert ops, real confidential stuff going on!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: C'mon, Yangyang. It's just an one-on-one meeting with Madam Magistrate. What's the worst that could happen?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Relax, relax!

Options.PlotLineKey: I wouldn't be so sure about that.
Indeed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey! Are you really trying to stress her out?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I guess you're right... Still, please be careful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll be waiting for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You solve the sundial puzzle. A note appears that directs you to the Grand Library at City Hall. Noticing something unusual about the sundial, you decide to go there alone.

Chapters.Title: Enter the City Hall and find the Grand Library
Enter the City Hall and find the Grand Library
Inspect the map of the Grand Library
Move the vases to correct positions

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think I heard a low, grumbling noise...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The vase didn’t budge at all. Not this one. I should go check on the other vases…

Chapters.Title: Enter the Grand Library via the hidden entrance
Investigate and wait in the Grand Library

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A hidden passage... As I expected.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That must be the entrance to the Database.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A part of the building is submerged... I should be able to find the hidden path underwater.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems I have a puzzle to solve. Guess I will check on the mechanism in the middle first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "...Gather five tones to align in tune. The Bells shall guide your path."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "...Find keynotes to determine tone. The Archive shall be unmasked."

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. The control panel here does look like a musical instrument, but five music notes seem to be missing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So to gain access to the Database, I will need to recover the five missing notes stored in those Sonodisks...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is that sound coming from behind the <ano=control panel>Symphodai</ano>?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This must be one of the missing notes. Now... How do I connect it with the Symphodai?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Part of the Scoreholder just lit up. As I expected.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The drum over there seems to have unlocked.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Bell just raised out of the water... So that's what it meant by having the Bells guide my path.

Chapters.Title: Strike the Bell and adjust it to the correct orientation

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A new walkway has shown up. I must have solved the first puzzle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seems I will need to look for more Sonodisks in there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tacet Discords... Inside the City Hall?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, they are not real... They must be some kind of digital simulation. It seems they are the guards here. Interesting how I'm not hearing sirens, despite having destroyed every one of them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Apart from the simulated Tacet Discords, It's unusually quiet in this place...

Chapters.Title: Check the clues of the next Sonodisk

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "...Multiply fifty-four with four thirds for the Frequency you seek. Find this note in the West, while the prophet is beyond reach."

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I suppose it's telling me where I can find the next Sonodisk... I think it mentioned a direction. What does that last sentence mean, though...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That sound... It's coming from the west.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the second Sonodisk. I should bring it to the Symphodai.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The water level just dropped again. There's another two drums, one in the east, and another in the west.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I may find more Sonodisks down there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So this is the right way to go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am being fed just enough information to work out the puzzle. This does look like Miss Magistrate's doing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems locked... Guess I'll need to activate the other one first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Another Bell just rose up from the water, but it's still locked... I'll need to connect the passageways first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The drum on the other side has unlocked. Guess I'll go check on it before I leave, just to be safe.

Chapters.Title: Strike the Bell and adjust it to the correct orientation
Take the Elevator to reach Upper Levels
Take the Elevator to reach Upper Levels
Head to where the Sound comes from

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The music I just heard... It must be the Sonodisk.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here it is. Time to deal with the guards.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Jinzhou's City Hall is the political hub, while the Grand Library holds vital data. Considering how I just took out all those guards, this place is oddly under-protected. If my guess is correct, the Magistrate may have other plans for me...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Anyway. I'll keep going.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've retrieved the third Sonodisk. Time to head back.

Chapters.Title: Strike the Bell and adjust it to the correct orientation

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Another platform.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ”The Bells will lead my path," huh. I'll go work out the passageways.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (This feeling... I am being watched.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Must be another Sonodisk.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems the guards only show up when someone approaches a Sonodisk.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the fourth missing note.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Almost there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now the water is all gone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One last note to go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the last one. They've prepared quite the welcome for me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have the last Sonodisk ready. Time to go back to the Symphodai.

Chapters.Title: Take the Elevator to reach Upper Levels

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now I should have access to the Database...

Chapters.Title: Check the Database for More Information

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So this is the "Grand Library." It's said to hold the answers to every question imaginable...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not seeing anyone here. I guess the Magistrate is yet to arrive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, it wouldn't hurt to browse the archives for a bit as I wait for her to show up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you just offer yourself up to be my prey? Hehe...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now... It's just the two of us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stow away that irrational anger of yours.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I just have a friendly reminder for you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seeing is not always believing. Why are you so sure they told you the truth? Don't jump to conclusions so soon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why are you so stubborn? Why can't you place some of that trust in me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or... Do I have to crush you to make you behave for once!

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you knew I was following you all along.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My Elysium only breaks under coordinated attacks from both sides. I can never get rid of all these pesky little helpers around you, can I?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you've joined hands against me with Miss Magistrate here. It does hurt my feelings, you know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're always so, so popular...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you all right, Rover?

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm fine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course {Male=he;Female=she} is. How could I ever have the heart to hurt {Male=him;Female=her}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Consider my moment of failure a gift of sincerity, Rover. I trust you haven't forgotten our conversation earlier.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Choose me. I'll tell you everything you want.

Options.PlotLineKey: I already know everything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh. I see... So she made the move before I could, and told you all of it already.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then, as the winners... Would you be so kind as to tell me how you set me up?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You defeat Scar, but he appears unbothered over what will happen to him. He is more curious to know when you and Jinhsi hatched this trap.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's been three days.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've both made it on time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Allow me to formally introduce myself. I am Jinhsi. It brings me great joy to see you, Rover.

Options.PlotLineKey: Hello.
Why wait three days to meet me in person?
Did something happen?
I hope I'm not talking to another projection.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To show up as a projection again would be ill-mannered of me. Please rest assured, it is a real human in the flesh you're speaking to. Despite Huanglong's advanced technology, such a realistic projection is still impossible.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or perhaps you would like to verify it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jinhsi smiles genuinely and offers her hand to you, radiating calmness and sincerity.

Options.PlotLineKey: (Shake her hand.)
Are you injured?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...It is nothing to be concerned about.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An emergency forced me to leave, and I only had the time to prepare some tokens for you. Please pardon my lack of hospitality.

Options.PlotLineKey: Does that emergency have something to do with the Fractsidus?
Does that emergency have something to do with your Sentinel?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Yes. The Sentinel of Jinzhou is currently absent.

Options.PlotLineKey: Aren't they supposed to stay in their domains?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Correct.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinels guide and guard humanity as a symbol of our civilization.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When a region's Sentinel goes absent, chaos is bound to ensue. As this news could lead to civil unrest, please keep it a secret.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jinzhou's Sentinel, "Jué," is being held captive by the Fractsidus. I had to postpone our meeting and put all my effort into finding its whereabouts.

Options.PlotLineKey: I heard you can resonate with the Sentinel?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, our thoughts are connected to a certain degree. I can sense its memories, feelings, and surroundings, though not very clearly.

Options.PlotLineKey: Have you found it yet?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unfortunately, I haven't. I can feel Jué is in danger. The good news is, I have figured out the culprit behind all of this.

Options.PlotLineKey: Is it Scar?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Precisely.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus plans to advance another Lament and cause disasters worldwide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Overseer Scar had several objectives upon infilrtrating Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To track you down, to test your strengths, and to make you join their cause. To abduct Jué and to resurrect the Threnodian in advance.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They must have discovered your value, likely from one of Jué's prophecies. If you join them, they'll gain significant power.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Should you refuse to join, the Fractsidus will likely want to eliminate you so you don't get in their way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have a plan to apprehend Scar. Once we capture him, the Fractsidus won't be that much of a threat to you for the time being.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you are willing to lend us a hand, I will ensure your safety during our cooperation.

Options.PlotLineKey: Count me in.
Can I have some time to think?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for your trust, Rover.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course. Your decision is valued, Rover.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of which, you seem to have already gathered a lot from the tokens.

Options.PlotLineKey: The mangosteen points to how people lived through the wars in Jinzhou.
The sugar pearl points to past epidemics and disasters.
The leaf points to the Fractsidus.
The sundial points to when and where we are meeting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Impressive, Rover.

Options.PlotLineKey: And I learned more about my identity as I deciphered the tokens.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The threat Jinzhou is facing is far worse than meets the eye.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One of the Threnodians will soon be reawakened...

Options.PlotLineKey: What are the Threnodians?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They are the enemies of human civilizations, born from the dark side of our collective consciousness. We must defeat them to protect all of humanity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We have been doing our best to prevent the disaster, but the Fractsidus is accelerating the Threnodian's revival.

Options.PlotLineKey: And it has something to do with me, yes?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indeed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have defeated the Crownless and absorbed its Echo with your bare hands. It is the Tacet Discord that embodies the concept of warfare.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Resentment of the fallen, fright of the ignoble... Those are the emotions that laid grounds for its birth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Crownless is a Tacet Discord that possesses powers from the reviving Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jinzhou is a border city with an unbreakable will and strong spirit of resistance. However, we also fear the constant wars and loss of life, and the Threnodian can prey on that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You, however... You were able to defeat and absorb a Threnodian-related Tacet Discord with your bare hands, and resonate with other TDs.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meanwhile, Huanglong's records mention a hero with similar powers who saved our nation during the Threnodian War. {Male=He;Female=She} is also mentioned in literature dating back to Jinzhou's establishment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To uncover your true identity, this could be a helpful lead to pursue.

Options.PlotLineKey: You believe that person and I could be related in some way?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Based on my own deduction, and the prophecies of Jué.

Options.PlotLineKey: Jué... In the Gorges of Spirits...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean... The unfinished statue of Jué?

Options.PlotLineKey: I remembered something when I saw it...
But I'm not sure if that really happened.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. Do you mind letting me know what you remembered? Since it's related to our Sentinel, I might be able to help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You tell Jinhsi about the fragmented memories you were able to remember.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, the memories of which you speak...

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes? Anything worth noting about them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As I mentioned earlier, I can resonate with Jué, our Sentinel. Your recollections... They align with what I've witnessed in Jué's memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, I do remember seeing something similar... I believe it had truly happened in the past.

Options.PlotLineKey: In other words...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In other words, you may be the person mentioned in our records.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The unwavering presence by our Sentinel's side, bonded by an unbreakable trust.

Options.PlotLineKey: I don't reckon Resonators can live that long.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Resonators tend to have a longer lifespan, but it is indeed unprecedented to live hundreds of years without any sign of aging.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So many mysteries about you remain unsolved, and your age is just one of the unknowns.

Options.PlotLineKey: If this is true, who was I all that time ago?
Then how did I end up losing my memories?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, but I don't know. Jué's last piece of information pointed to the Norfall Barrens, where you should find the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I pray you will find your answers there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Threnodian is resurrecting, and our nation is in grave danger. This reminds me of the Threnodian War all too much. Perhaps... This has something to do with your mysterious appearance in Jinzhou?

Options.PlotLineKey: You mean I showed up to protect Jinzhou like the historical hero did?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not really. I don't plan to believe in a hero showing up out of nowhere and protecting us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am just presenting whatever lead I have about your past, as I know it is troubling you. I want to help you, and that is all there is to it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for considering lending us a hand. Your help is much appreciated, but please do not feel obligated because of the information I shared.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They are my people, and the responsibility to keep them safe should fall on no one else but my own shoulders.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am saying this because I have faith in my abilities, and even more so in the bravery of Jinzhou's soldiers and our people.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You deserve to make your own decision about this after uncovering your true identity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I appreciate everything you've done for us, during the past few days, or perhaps even longer ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once it all settles, I am ready to accommodate and assist in whatever future decision you make. You can leave Jinzhou, or the entire Huanglong if you wish.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you ever need me again, you need only ask.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's keep this a secret between the two of us. How does that sound?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The sundial holds two puzzles. Solving the second unveils a message from Jinhsi, inviting you to a meeting under the cloak of night. When she arrives, she reveals secrets about Jinzhou and the Threnodians, shedding light on your identity, and hints that you might be a legendary figure mentioned in ancient records.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Now I have retrieved the Magistrate's message for me from the puzzle box.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (But it only points me to where the Grand Library is. There's no meeting time... Something is still missing.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I've solved the puzzle, the disks have been rotated, and the two symbols are now glowing.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (With this glowing light, a shadow is cast on two other symbols.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The Black Tortoise of the North... North to the City Hall.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (And the time reads... The <ano=Time Period>Shichen</ano> of Chou, in the Wei hours of the morning.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Scar, you are now under arrest for committing multiple felonies in Huanglong. Do you have anything to say?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do I want to say, huh? While I'd love to tell you another story... I guess that's not what you want to hear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's cut to the chase, “Madam Magistrate.” I'm getting bored already.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Very well. You will answer only our questions from now on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure, why not. What do you want to know?

Options.PlotLineKey: Why did you kidnap Jué?
Why are you obsessed with reviving the Threnodian?
What on earth is the Lament?
Why were you following me?
I'm done with him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A <ano=Oracle Engine>Sentinel</ano> such as Jué can predict and "correct" future events. It gets in our way of achieving our sublime vision.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We merely wanted to topple the set future built on lies, and take control of our own destiny.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Threnodians... They hold the key to our ideal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Together they will bring us the promised "true Lament," and we will embrace the new world that is bound to come.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is the Lament? Disaster? Curse? Some kind of punishment? Ha! People only see the surface...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Lament brings death, destruction, and countless Reverberations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Reverberations that will be reflected, overlapped, and interwoven during the Lament... They will be our salvation, the only path to a new lifeform and a new civilization.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our goal has always been the same... We want you. Want you to join us.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why me?
And if I say no?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Forces battle over you, causing all this strife, and yet you remain unaware of your own worth... Are you really that naive, or are you just dense?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whatever. Our interest in you is not affected by such trivial matters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Too bad. We will then be forced to kill you, by any means necessary...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I'm sure you'll willingly come to us... When the time arrives.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You kidnapped Jué and revived the Threnodian, accelerating the next Lament... This is proof enough that you are the enemy of Jinzhou, and all humanity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stop dreaming you can force Rover to join you. {Male=He;Female=She} is our honored guest, and I will not allow any harm to come {Male=his;Female=her} way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha! How confident you sound. As the Threnodian's resurrection approaches, Jinzhou is barely holding on. How much longer do you think you can keep up this facade?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for your concern. We have crushed your schemes once, and we can do it again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have one last question for you. Abducting "Jué," stalking Rover, and setting up an ambush in Qichi Village... You couldn't have accomplished that all on your own.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unless...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unless I'm not the only Overseer in Jinzhou, right? Hahaha...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have answered all your questions with full honesty. I don't mind you knowing, because it won't make any difference.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can try to stop us with all you have... But it's too late to change the course of history.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, I have one question for you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You seem convinced we caused the disappearance of Jué... What if I told you there was more to it? Would you be curious?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: About Jué... What else do you know?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come closer and I'll tell you, Madam Magistrate... It's a secret for your ears only...

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How dare you! Madam Magistrate, I...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, it can't be...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shocked, aren't you? But there's more...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What if I told you... Your Sentinel had made this prophecy a long, long time ago?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your all-seeing Sentinel abandons you now of all times. Need I say more?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're merely adding a touch of extra fuel to the fire that will soon consume all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, care for a wager? I know you've been searching for answers about your past, and I've got news for you—

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Watch out!

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are one of us, the "black lambs," and you have been chosen to join us ushering in the new world...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once you discover what you really are, you will come to us with no hesitation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus awaits your arrival with open arms.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And I look forward to that day in sincere anticipation...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehehehehe.... AHAHAHAHAHA!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After the interrogation, Scar is put in jail...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You ask Scar why the Fractsidus is holding Jué captive and attempting to awaken the Threnodian. He explains their goal of creating a new world order and invites you to join them. Before being taken away, Scar whispers a secret to Jinhsi that visibly unsettles her.

Options.PlotLineKey: What did Scar tell you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Sorry, Rover. What he mentioned about our Sentinel is... highly sensitive. I cannot disclose it yet, not before verifying it myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is it a ploy to create distrust among us, or... I must first find our Sentinel to uncover the truth.

Options.PlotLineKey: How important is Jué to Jinzhou?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jué is the Guardian Sentinel of Jinzhou. It is responsible for assisting Jinzhou's Magistrate in administrative affairs.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: While I am final decision maker... Without the assistance of Jué, I cannot guarantee I'm always making the best choices for my people.

Options.PlotLineKey: You seem to be doing well enough on your own.
Why are you so sure Jué is always right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: T-Thank you. I am glad you think so.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jué can predict the future, and up to this point, every one of its prophecies have been proven true.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jué can predict the future, and up to this point, every one of its prophecies have been proven true.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: While justice may not be universally agreed upon, its decisions have consistently served the best interests of Huanglong.

Options.PlotLineKey: Perhaps it left to set Jinzhou's future right.
Perhaps it intended to let you make your own decisions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For that... I suppose we will have to talk to it in person to find out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In addition, Rover, Jué once told me to deliver a message to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "To the Awakened One: When raindrops fall upstream, please head to the Norfall Barrens, and seek General Jiyan of the Midnight Rangers."

Options.PlotLineKey: So I'll need to find this General Jiyan?
So I'll need to go to the Norfall Barrens?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I suppose so. General Jiyan is currently battling another TD Outbreak in the Norfall Barrens, which will also serve as our frontline against the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the ongoing war has made it a very dangerous place to go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since you won't need to go there right now, not until when the "raindrops fall upstream"...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know you're here for clues about your true identity, and I don't want you to leave the city empty-handed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have you heard about the Black Shores, Rover?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's an organization shrouded in mystery, with a secretive membership process and members who usually keep their identities hidden.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Upon your awakening, one of their members discreetly contacted me to gather information about you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But please don't worry. The Black Shores developed a special Lament prediction system, and has established partnerships with countries worldwide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: While operating in secrecy, they are not an extremist group like the Fractsidus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They have been monitoring the situation in Jinzhou to provide assistance when needed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks to their extra help, my meeting with you went smoothly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This Blake Bloom is their symbol. The Black Shores members usually wear it on their person.

Options.PlotLineKey: What do they want to achieve in Jinzhou?
There sure are a lot of people keeping an eye on me.
Wouldn't that make them easy to spot?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Black Shores once provided us significant insights into the relationship between the moon and Threnodians.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This time, they've come to inform us a Threnodian is about to resurrect near Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Apart from that, I am not sure what else they may be hoping to achieve.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, after the recent series of events, I trust you have gained a general idea of who you might have been.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before you fell into that deep slumber, you likely played a significant role in important historical events, shaping the course of history in some way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ultimately... I suppose it is up to you to discover the final definitive answer for yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, I suppose it does make them stand out. On the other hand, they presumably possess extraordinary abilities to stay anonymous.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This photo is yours to keep. I will return with Jué shortly, and the Black Shores may be worth your try during this time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jinhsi reveals a prophecy from Jué foretelling your quest to find Commander Jiyan in the Norfall Barrens at a time when raindrops fall upstream. Until that day comes, she advises you to seek out an organization known as the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover! Are you all right?

Options.PlotLineKey: I saw something... I was wearing the Blake Bloom...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see... The Black Shores must have a deep connection to your past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since you are likely being closely monitored by the Fractsidus now...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I suggest keeping an eye out for the Black Shore members. They could prove to be your valuable allies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll do my best to find Jué, and tell you everything I learned from it once I return.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is my promise.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm counting on you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Please leave it to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sanhua.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, Madam Magistrate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will be going on a temporary leave. During my absence, please help me handle my responsibilities in Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Understood. Should I continue protecting that Rover?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No need. Both Changli and I will be away, and there'll be more than enough paperwork for you to handle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is Lady Changli leaving for the capital?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please pardon my intrusion, but {Male=he;Female=she} just faced an ambush in the Central Plains. What if...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Regarding that incident... We tried to warn {Male=him;Female=her} about the Fractsidus, but they were more cunning than we thought.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If {Male=he;Female=she} runs into another powerful enemy like Scar, {Male=he;Female=she}'ll eventually have to confront them on {Male=his;Female=her} own.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sanhua, you can place more trust in Rover and me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Understood. I will.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My lady... No matter what happens, my sword is always yours.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Both the interrogation and my appointed meeting with Rover have already finished.
Scar only needed the two of you as his audience. We already knew what he wanted, and we let him have as much.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {Male=He;Female=She} decrypted every message we intended to convey. It's only proper you meet {Male=him;Female=her} in person, as the one who crafted those puzzles.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Such intricate puzzles... I guess only Rover has the patience to solve them all.
No detail is too small. I'm sure {Male=he;Female=she} understands. Besides... Not seeing the opponent heightens the thrill of the game.
If everything goes according to the prophecies of Jué, I will meet {Male=him;Female=her} in person eventually.
So... What did our captive from the Fractsidus tell you about Jué?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...That Jué had predicted I will have to fight it one day. A fight that will shape Jinzhou's future.
Well, that is... unexpected. But you don't seem all that surprised, do you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can't say I am. I had suspected as much from our previous conversations, and the message it left me... His words only confirmed it.
Where was it when you last sensed its presence?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was... In Mt. Firmament. Unlike Jinzhou city, that mountain is still resting in "stillness."
The place where the first people of Jinzhou lived, and where Jué first manifested before us humans... I see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll find Jué and bring it back as soon as possible.
Our enemies could have planned it as a trap. We have a bigger goal to focus on, remember?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I understand. I will not let anything or anyone disrupt the peace in Jinzhou.
Would you let what you heard from Scar sway your determination?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, he cannot ever turn me against Jué. If anything, his words only confirmed my theory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am the Magistrate of Jinzhou, appointed by the Sentinel itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The prophecy speaks of a decisive incident for Jinzhou's future, where I will be a key player. The fight between me and Jué is only a precursor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My job remains unchanged. I will fulfill my duty as Jinzhou's Magistrate with my own judgment.
And that's your final answer?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A single strand's neglect births mountainous upheaval. You taught me that, remember?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The safest option is for me to go in person.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Very well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since we are already mid-game, I will let you decide our next move.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This time, I shall be a pawn in your hand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember I will always stand by your side, in this crisis or any other.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Am I a player or a mere pawn? I suppose there is no difference at this point.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No matter what, I will do what I must.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After your departure, Jinhsi reaches out to her mentor, Changli. Jué prophesied a showdown between Jinhsi and itself at Mt. Firmament, a place where time stands still. Determined to protect Jinzhou's future, Jinhsi vows to face Jué alone. Changli, impressed by her growth, pledges her support.
